<ce:section-title id="sectitle0045">Preparations</ce:section-title><ce:section-title id="sectitle0050">[Ni(<ce:bold>L</ce:bold>
<ce:sup loc="post">
<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>
</ce:sup>)(AIPA)·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O]<ce:inf loc="post">n,</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0055" view="all">A mixture of Ni(OAc)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·4H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.025 g, 0.10 mmol), <ce:bold>L</ce:bold>
<ce:sup loc="post">
<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>
</ce:sup> (0.032 g, 0.10 mmol), H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>AIPA (0.022 g, 0.10 mmol) and 5 mL of MeOH/H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (1:1, v/v) was sealed in a 23 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel autoclave which was heated under autogenous pressure to 120 °C for two days and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature at a rate of 2 °C per hour. Green crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction were obtained. Yield: 0.049 g (79%). Anal. Calcd for C<ce:inf loc="post">28</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">25</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>NiO<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf> (MW = 643.22): C, 53.03; H, 3.97; N, 11.04. Found: C, 52.51; H, 3.98; N, 11.02. FT-IR (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3749 (w), 3648 (w), 3503 (w), 3360 (m), 2360 (w), 1671 (s), 1653 (s), 1603 (w), 1535 (s), 1485 (s), 1396 (s), 1328 (m), 1278 (m), 780 (w), 721 (m), 696 (m).</ce:para><ce:section-title id="sectitle0055">[Co(<ce:bold>L</ce:bold>
<ce:sup loc="post">
<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>
</ce:sup>)(AIPA)·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O]<ce:inf loc="post">n,</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0060" view="all">Prepared as described for <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> except that Co(OAc)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·4H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.025 g, 0.10 mmol) were used. Red crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction were obtained. Yield: 0.056 g (88%). Anal. Calcd for C<ce:inf loc="post">28</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">25</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>CoO<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf> (MW = 643.46): C, 53.01; H, 3.97; N, 11.04. Found: C, 52.32; H, 3.96; N, 11.09. FT-IR (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3749 (w), 3648 (w), 3502 (w), 3363 (m), 2359 (w), 1660 (s), 1643 (s), 1542 (s), 1484 (s), 1448 (s), 1386 (m), 1329 (m), 1294 (m), 778 (m), 719 (m), 697 (m).</ce:para><ce:section-title id="sectitle0060">

Green crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction were obtained. Yield: 0.029 g (47%). Anal. Calcd for C<ce:inf loc="post">26</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">29</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>NiO<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf> (MW = 614.23): C, 48.33; H, 4.06; N, 9.40. Found: C, 48.48; H, 4.10; N, 9.67. Red crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction were obtained. Yield: 0.030 g (65%). Anal. Found: C, 47.67; H, 3.98; N, 9.22. FT-IR (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3853 (w), 3734 (w), 3674 (w), 3648 (w), 3525 (w), 3394 (w), 3070 (w), 2359 (w), 1684 (m), 1617 (m), 1556 (s), 1541 (s), 1395 (s), 1112(w), 816 (w), 779 (w), 729 (w).</ce:para><ce:section-title id="sectitle0070">[Co(<ce:bold>L</ce:bold>
<ce:sup loc="post">
<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>
</ce:sup>)(2,4-PDC)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)]<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>, (<ce:bold>5</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0075" view="all">Prepared as described for <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> except that a mixture of Co(CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.029 g, 0.10 mmol), <ce:bold>L</ce:bold>
<ce:sup loc="post">
<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>
</ce:sup> (0.033 g, 0.10 mmol) and 2,4-H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>PDC (0.017 g, 0.10 mmol) in 10 mL of NaOH solution (0.02 M) was used. Pink crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction were obtained. Yield: 0.025 g (43%). Anal Calcd for C<ce:inf loc="post">25</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">27</ce:inf>CoN<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">7</ce:inf> (MW = 568.44): C, 52.82; H, 4.79; N, 12.32%. C<ce:inf loc="post">25</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">28</ce:inf>CoN<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">7.5</ce:inf> (MW = 577.45) (complex <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> + 0.5H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O): C, 52.00; H, 4.89; N, 12.13%. Found: C, 52.00; H, 4.72; N, 11.52%. IR (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3282(m), 3234(m), 3072(m), 2937(m), 2859(m), 1706(m), 1682(m), 1620(s), 1600(s), 1546(s), 1488(s), 1434(s), 1410(m), 1375(s), 1337(s), 1287(s), 1234(m), 1194(m), 1166(m), 1081(w), 1052(w), 1022(w), 952(w), 921(w), 906(w), 879(w), 861(w), 826(m), 802(w), 781(m), 720(m), 701(m), 683(m), 645(m), 579(w), 517(w), 484(w), 445(w), 419(w).</ce:para><ce:section-title id="sectitle0075">[Co(<ce:bold>L</ce:bold>
<ce:sup loc="post">
<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>
</ce:sup>)(5-Br-IPA)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)]<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>, (<ce:bold>6</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0080" view="all">Prepared as described for <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> except that a mixture of Co(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>⋅6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.029 g, 0.10 mmol), <ce:bold>L</ce:bold>
<ce:sup loc="post">
<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>
</ce:sup> (0.033 g, 0.10 mmol) and 5-bromoisophthalic acid (0.025 g, 0.10 mmol) in 10 mL of H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O was used. Pink crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction were obtained. Yield: 0.0124 g (19%). Anal Calcd for C<ce:inf loc="post">26</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">26</ce:inf>BrCoN<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">7</ce:inf> (MW = 645.33): C, 48.39; H, 4.06; N, 8.68%. C<ce:inf loc="post">26</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">27</ce:inf>BrCoN<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">7.5</ce:inf> (MW = 654.35) (complex <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> + 0.5H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O): C, 47.72; H, 4.16; N, 8.56%. Found: C, 47.79; H, 4.18; N, 8.04%. IR (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3287(m), 3066(m), 2962(m), 2933(m), 2852(w), 1816(w), 1705(m), 1678(m), 1609(m), 1583(m), 1550(s), 1487(s), 1427(s), 1371(s), 1292(m), 1276(m), 1239(m), 1192(m), 1163(w), 1128(w), 1106(w), 1053(w), 1028(w), 994(w), 955(w), 913(w), 858(w), 803(m), 777(m), 741(m), 698(m), 667(w), 644(m), 594(w), 529(w), 502(w), 488(w), 460(w), 433(w), 421(w), 405(w).</ce:para>
clean_text:
Preparations

[Ni(L  1 )(AIPA)⋅2H2O]n, (1)

A mixture of Ni(OAc)2⋅4H2O (0.025g, 0.10mmol), L  1  (0.032g, 0.10mmol), H2AIPA (0.022g, 0.10mmol) and 5mL of MeOH/H2O (1:1, v/v) was sealed in a 23mL Teflon-lined stainless steel autoclave which was heated under autogenous pressure to 120°C for two days and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature at a rate of 2°C per hour. Green crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction were obtained. Yield: 0.049g (79%). Anal. Calcd for C28H25N5NiO9 (MW=643.22): C, 53.03; H, 3.97; N, 11.04. Found: C, 52.51; H, 3.98; N, 11.02. FT-IR (cm-1): 3749 (w), 3648 (w), 3503 (w), 3360 (m), 2360 (w), 1671 (s), 1653 (s), 1603 (w), 1535 (s), 1485 (s), 1396 (s), 1328 (m), 1278 (m), 780 (w), 721 (m), 696 (m).

[Co(L  1 )(AIPA)⋅2H2O]n, (2)

Prepared as described for 1 except that Co(OAc)2⋅4H2O (0.025g, 0.10mmol) were used. Red crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction were obtained. Yield: 0.056g (88%). Anal. Calcd for C28H25N5CoO9 (MW=643.46): C, 53.01; H, 3.97; N, 11.04. Found: C, 52.32; H, 3.96; N, 11.09. FT-IR (cm-1): 3749 (w), 3648 (w), 3502 (w), 3363 (m), 2359 (w), 1660 (s), 1643 (s), 1542 (s), 1484 (s), 1448 (s), 1386 (m), 1329 (m), 1294 (m), 778 (m), 719 (m), 697 (m).

 [Ni(  L    2   )(AIPA)(H  2  O)  2  ]  n,  ( 3  ) 

Prepared as described for 1 except that Ni(OAc)2⋅4H2O (0.025g, 0.10mmol), L  2  (0.030g, 0.10mmol), H2AIPA (0.022g, 0.10mmol) and 5mL of MeOH/H2O (1:1, v/v) was used. Green crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction were obtained. Yield: 0.029g (47%). Anal. Calcd for C26H29N5NiO9 (MW=614.23): C, 48.33; H, 4.06; N, 9.40. Found: C, 48.48; H, 4.10; N, 9.67. FT-IR (cm-1): 3855 (w), 3752 (w), 3650 (w), 3307 (m), 1664 (m), 1549 (s), 1489 (m), 1446 (m), 1368 (m), 791(m), 727(m).

[Co(L  2 )0.5(AIPA)(H2O)]n, (4)

Prepared as described for 3 except that Co(OAc)2⋅4H2O (0.025g, 0.10mmol) were used. Red crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction were obtained. Yield: 0.030g (65%). Anal. Calcd for C18H18N3CoO7 (MW=447.28): C, 47.36; H, 4.19; N, 9.21. Found: C, 47.67; H, 3.98; N, 9.22. FT-IR (cm-1): 3853 (w), 3734 (w), 3674 (w), 3648 (w), 3525 (w), 3394 (w), 3070 (w), 2359 (w), 1684 (m), 1617 (m), 1556 (s), 1541 (s), 1395 (s), 1112(w), 816 (w), 779 (w), 729 (w).

[Co(L  3 )(2,4-PDC)(H2O)]n, (5)

Prepared as described for 1 except that a mixture of Co(CH3CO2)2⋅2H2O (0.029g, 0.10mmol), L  3  (0.033g, 0.10mmol) and 2,4-H2PDC (0.017g, 0.10mmol) in 10mL of NaOH solution (0.02M) was used. Pink crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction were obtained. Yield: 0.025g (43%). Anal Calcd for C25H27CoN5O7 (MW=568.44): C, 52.82; H, 4.79; N, 12.32%. C25H28CoN5O7.5 (MW=577.45) (complex 1 + 0.5H2O): C, 52.00; H, 4.89; N, 12.13%. Found: C, 52.00; H, 4.72; N, 11.52%. IR (cm-1): 3282(m), 3234(m), 3072(m), 2937(m), 2859(m), 1706(m), 1682(m), 1620(s), 1600(s), 1546(s), 1488(s), 1434(s), 1410(m), 1375(s), 1337(s), 1287(s), 1234(m), 1194(m), 1166(m), 1081(w), 1052(w), 1022(w), 952(w), 921(w), 906(w), 879(w), 861(w), 826(m), 802(w), 781(m), 720(m), 701(m), 683(m), 645(m), 579(w), 517(w), 484(w), 445(w), 419(w).

[Co(L  3 )(5-Br-IPA)(H2O)]n, (6)

Prepared as described for 1 except that a mixture of Co(NO3)2⋅6H2O (0.029g, 0.10mmol), L  3  (0.033g, 0.10mmol) and 5-bromoisophthalic acid (0.025g, 0.10mmol) in 10mL of H2O was used. Pink crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction were obtained. Yield: 0.0124g (19%). Anal Calcd for C26H26BrCoN4O7 (MW=645.33): C, 48.39; H, 4.06; N, 8.68%. C26H27BrCoN4O7.5 (MW=654.35) (complex 2 + 0.5H2O): C, 47.72; H, 4.16; N, 8.56%. Found: C, 47.79; H, 4.18; N, 8.04%. IR (cm-1): 3287(m), 3066(m), 2962(m), 2933(m), 2852(w), 1816(w), 1705(m), 1678(m), 1609(m), 1583(m), 1550(s), 1487(s), 1427(s), 1371(s), 1292(m), 1276(m), 1239(m), 1192(m), 1163(w), 1128(w), 1106(w), 1053(w), 1028(w), 994(w), 955(w), 913(w), 858(w), 803(m), 777(m), 741(m), 698(m), 667(w), 644(m), 594(w), 529(w), 502(w), 488(w), 460(w), 433(w), 421(w), 405(w).
